page.title: 02THE RAILWAY WALK
page.content: The railway walk is a pathway from the town of St. Helier to the headland of La Corbiere. The route which the pathway takes is along the old railway track which used to run from the town to the west of the island. The tracks were lifted up in 1936 but relaid by the Germans. After the war the route was made into an attractive walkway. The first part of it runs along the picturesque St. Aubin's Bay where a station has now been converted into a cafe. After St Aubin, trains passed through the countryside. This part of the path has been lined with plants and trees. The whole pathway is used by the local people and the tourists. It serves as a route to school for many children, as a jogging track, a cycle track, or simply as a place for a family stroll after Sunday lunch.
